content:
Customize Milestone Page Layouts

To customize page layouts for milestones to help support agents and supervisors track support progress.

Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with the Service Cloud

User permissions needed:
- To create and edit page layouts: Customize Application
- To create milestones: Manage Entitlements and Customize Application
- To enable the Stopped Time and Actual Elapsed Time fields: Manage Entitlements

Fields to add to case and object milestone detail pages:
- Actual Elapsed Time
- Completed
- Completion Date
- Elapsed Time
- Entitlement Process
- Start Date
- Stopped Time
- Target Date
- Target Response
- Time Remaining
- Time Since Target
- Violation

To customize page layouts, from Setup in Salesforce Classic:
- Enter Case Milestones in the Quick Find box
- Click Page Layouts under Case Milestones
- Edit case milestone detail page layouts

In Lightning Experience:
- Enter Object Milestones in the Quick Find box
- Click Page Layouts under Object Milestones
- Edit object milestone detail page layouts

Field descriptions:
- Actual Elapsed Time: The amount of time that it took to complete a milestone.
- Completed: Icon that indicates milestone completion.
- Completion Date: The date and time the milestone was completed.
- Elapsed Time: The time it took to complete a milestone. Automatically calculated to include any business hours on the support record.
- Entitlement Process: The entitlement process that is being used for the record. 
- Start Date: The date and time that the milestone tracking started.
- Stopped Time: How long an agent has been blocked from completing a milestone.
- Target Date: The date and time to complete the milestone.
- Target Response: The time to complete the milestone. Automatically calculated to include any business hours on the support record.
- Time Remaining: The time that remains before a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include any business hours on the support record.
- Time Since Target: The time that has elapsed since a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include any business hours on the support record.
- Violation: Icon that indicates a milestone violation.

Add milestone elements to case and work order page layouts by using Setup in Salesforce Classic or Lightning Experience, and add milestone fields such as Milestone Status and Entitlement Process Start Time.
title: Customizing Milestone Page Layouts in Service Cloud
